title: Applied Policy Researcher
description:

We have built the fastest-growing, open-source, collaborative library of pre-trained models in the world. With more than 500K+ models and 250K+ stars on GitHub, over 15.000 companies are using HF technology in production, including leading AI organizations such as Google, Elastic, Salesforce, Algolia, and Grammarly.

Hugging Face has become the most popular, community-driven project for training, sharing, and deploying the most advanced machine learning models. Workload efficiency is key to our mission of democratizing state of the art and we are always looking to push the boundaries for faster, and more efficient ways to train and deploy models.

About the job

We are looking for an Applied Policy Researcher to join our Machine Learning and Society team. You will work at the intersection of regulatory and technical questions to help bridge policymakers' and developers' perspectives by building tools and participating in policy conversations, through written communications and in person.

Hugging Face's mission includes making ML systems more accessible and beneficial to people with all levels of technical expertise. As regulations and standards are taking a growing place in public conversations on AI, this increasingly includes ensuring that policymakers have sufficient visibility into the specifics of the technology and that developers have the tools they need to implement new requirements; especially in an open and collaborative development setting. The Applied Policy Researcher will be at the forefront of these efforts, developing tools and integrating state-of-the-art evaluations to help support ongoing public governance efforts - with a focus on evaluating the technology's social impacts. They will also leverage this experience to provide feedback on regulatory proposals reflecting the current state of the technologyâ€™s capabilities and social context.

For additional context, you may want to have a look at our recent collaborations on governance in the BigCode project and evaluating the social impact of generative AI systems, as well as our recent policy communications on the EU AI Act, NTIA RFC on AI Accountability, and NAIRR RFC.

About you

We are looking for candidates who love building tools for and collaborating with the wider community and share our vision for accessible technology.

A good candidate for this role will have a multidisciplinary mindset and be comfortable working at the intersection of technical, regulatory, and ethical questions. The ability to quickly iterate on prototypes and to build accessible visualization tools to help analyze and explain the workings of recent ML systems, especially aspects that are the subject of proposed regulations, will be particularly valuable. The position also requires familiarity with prominent AI policy questions and regulatory proposals and an interest in writing regular policy memos and analyses. If you want to contribute to taking one of the fastest-growing ML companies to the next level, then we can't wait to see your application!

If you're interested in joining us, but your experience is different from the traditional mold, we still encourage you to apply! We're building a diverse team whose skills, experiences, and backgrounds complement one another, and we value and encourage having multiple perspectives. We're happy to consider where you might be able to have the most impact.

More about Hugging Face

We are actively working to build a culture that values diversity, equity, and inclusivity. We are intentionally building a workplace where people feel respected and supportedâ€”regardless of who you are or where you come from. We believe this is foundational to building a great company and community. Hugging Face is an equal-opportunity employer and we do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

We value development. You will work with some of the smartest people in our industry. We are an organization that has a bias for impact and is always challenging ourselves to continuously grow. We provide all employees with reimbursement for relevant conferences, training, and education.

We care about your well-being. We offer flexible working hours and remote options. We offer health, dental, and vision benefits for employees and their dependents. We also offer parental leave and unlimited paid time off.

We support our employees wherever they are. While we have office spaces in NYC and Paris, weâ€™re very distributed and all remote employees have the opportunity to visit our offices. If needed, weâ€™ll also outfit your workstation to ensure you succeed.

We want our teammates to be shareholders. All employees have company equity as part of their compensation package. If we succeed in becoming a category-defining platform in machine learning and artificial intelligence, everyone enjoys the upside.

We support the community. We believe major scientific advancements are the result of collaboration across the field. Join a community supporting the ML/AI community.

title: General Counsel
description:
What we're looking for

Flashbots is seeking a General Counsel who will play a pivotal role in defining our regulatory strategy and shaping the narrative of our organization in a clear and comprehensible manner.

The General Counsel must be attuned to the unique market structures within the crypto industry, translating regulatory expectations into a system that best suits our unique positioning.

This role is not just about managing existing legal and compliance matters but also about envisioning a future landscape where Flashbots continues to thrive.

Responsibilities

  • Ensuring compliance with relevant laws, regulations, and industry standards.

  • Providing legal advice and guidance to the executive team and other departments.

  • Drafting, reviewing, and negotiating contracts, agreements, and legal documents.

  • Managing and overseeing regulatory filings, licenses, and permits.

  • Developing and implementing internal policies and procedures.

  • Conducting legal research to stay updated on industry trends and changes in regulations.

  • Managing and collaborating with external legal counsel when necessary.

  • Assessing and mitigating legal risks and potential liabilities.

  • Participating in strategic decision-making and providing guidance on legal matters.

Qualifications

  • Juris Doctor (J.D.) degree and active membership in the bar association.

  • Extensive experience in legal practice, with a focus on regulatory compliance, financial services, or cryptocurrency.

  • Strong knowledge of relevant laws and regulations, such as securities, anti-money laundering (AML), know your customer (KYC), and data privacy.

  • Experience working in or with the crypto industry, understanding its unique challenges and opportunities.

  • Proven track record of successfully managing regulatory issues and compliance programs.

  • Excellent drafting, negotiation, and communication skills.

  • Ability to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams and senior executives.

Desired traits and skills

  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.

  • Ability to adapt and navigate through a rapidly evolving regulatory landscape.

  • High ethical standards and integrity.

  • Strong leadership and decision-making abilities.

  • Exceptional communication and interpersonal skills.

  • Detail-oriented with strong business acumen and strategic thinking.

  • Ability to translate complex legal and regulatory language into layman's terms for internal stakeholders.

  • A visionary, yet grounded approach to legal matters, with an ability to balance vision with operational considerations.

About Flashbots

Flashbots started in 2020 as a research and development organization formed to mitigate the negative externalities and existential risks posed by Maximal Extractable Value (MEV) to smart-contract blockchains, starting with Ethereum. We build products to maximally decentralize public blockchains, redistribute MEV, and empower users. We work closely with our community to ensure that our products have a positive impact, are secure, and can be used in production at scale.

Our Impact

Since the launch of Flashbots, we have had an immense impact on the world of cryptocurrency. The Flashbots Auction was launched in alpha in January 2021 and was quickly adopted by almost all Ethereum miners. Prior to Ethereum's Merge in 2022, Flashbots launched MEV-Boost, a temporary solution for out-of-protocol proposer-builder separation. MEV-Boost has since been adopted by over 90% of Ethereum validators and has significantly influenced the Ethereum PoS ecosystem. Now, Flashbots continues its journey with the introduction of MEV-Share as we continue our journey toward SUAVE.

Our Research

Flashbots Research is an independent arm of the organization that aims to become the hub of MEV research. In addition to conducting in-house analysis, Flashbots Research collaborates with external researchers at other institutions via an external grants program. Flashbots Research continues to publish seminal research on MEV, covering a wide range of topics including cross-chain MEV, EIP1559 and MEV, how ETH2 affects MEV, SGX and privacy, and more. For a full list of publications, visit writings.flashbots.net.

Why Flashbots?

  • Competitive salary

  • Significantly above market rate equity compensation package

  • Unlimited PTO with a high level of freedom and autonomy for your work

  • Attractive health cover package for US employees

  • Yearly budget for your individual learning and development goals

  • Work alongside the brightest minds in the crypto space

  • Help build the future of blockchain technology

  • Remote working - travel and work from anywhere in the world

  • Paid travel - team on-sites in different parts of the world, several times a year

At Flashbots, we are committed to building a diverse and inclusive team. We welcome applications from all qualified candidates regardless of their gender, race, ethnicity, religion, sexual orientation, age, or disability status.
